intro: Diosma tenuissima, commonly known as the slender diosma, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family, and is characterized by its delicate, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in chaparral and woodland habitats. Diosma tenuissima is a perennial herb that is relatively uncommon and has limited distribution.
